name: The Clifton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Clifton for three nights and had a superb balcony view. The room was a good size though we would have preferred a bigger bed. The breakfasts were excellent with an extensive selection of cold buffet, very good individually prepared hot breakfast and the yummiest of pastries.
reviews.title: Glorious views over the Solent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Clifton for three nights. Our first impression of the owner wasn’t a hospitable greeting, but a sarcastic comment. We were checked in & shown to our room by Alex, who obviously had more experience in hospitality. We had dinner in the sun room that one evening. The food & the view were nice and compensated for the atmosphere.
reviews.title: A mixed experience - not to be repeated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The en-suite shower room looked a little ‘tired’ but usable. The water pressure leaves a lot to be desired though. We had to run the hot tap in the basin for quite a while before the hot water made its way up to the top floor, but then it ran so slowly, it took twice as long to shower! On our third afternoon we returned to the room to find brown water leaking from the toilet, we cleaned it up ourselves & told the owner on our way out for the evening. His response was “Really? Ok, I’ll try to pop up there this evening to check”. No apology was offered. On our return that night he approached us (for the first time) to advise us that he couldn’t get a plumber in until Monday. We found the toilet had leaked again, although not as much as before. I took the photo as proof, as the owner gave the impression he didn’t believe us. On checking out the next morning, we paid the £7 for the two drinks we had with the evening meal on the day we arrived. The leak wasn’t mentioned and no apology given.
reviews.title: Generally ok, some irritations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into the Havelock, behind the Clifton, for the rest of our stay on the island. It was very nice.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great food, quiet retreat
Nice location, service less so
reviews.text: Arrived late and were phoned by the owner whilst in the car park to say the check-in desk closed half and hour ago (10pm). A bit surprised at this given only mention of check in times on the website, email and booking was "From 3pm". At least he bothered to phone and stay up, but he was not best pleased clearly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I stay for 5 nights in one the premeir rooms with a balcony and a seaview. Good size room with double doors opening on to the balcony which had 2 wicker chairs & table. Ensuite was small but not cramped. Plenty of hot water for a shower or bath. Bed linen & towels were changed daily.
reviews.title: A room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was cereals, fruit & juices along with fresh made tea or coffee & several choices for fresh cooked dishes. If you wanted to change from the set menu it was no problem. We also had a couple of evening meals and found them to be fresh and well cooked.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in outstanding location

reviews.text: The small bar is fairly well stocked and it very relaxing to sit in either the garden or the deck watching the sun set.
reviews.title: Excellent once again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner & staff are were helpfull & friendly. If I again visit The Isle I would stay here.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.text: We had a lovely 3 night stay at The Clifton at the start of September. It’s a Victorian hotel, but unlike many it’s not showing its age having been cleaned and nicely decorated in the last 18 months by its new owners. The dining room is a particularly attractive space with a lovely view over the sea through a semi circular bay window. We ate there on two evenings and on both had enjoyable good value meals from an imaginative specials menu. Breakfast was also very good with a number of freshly cooked options and lots of different fresh fruits, cereals, and pastries. The hotel is in a very quiet position, convenient for the beach or old town, but free from any traffic noise. Our room was functional, probably the hotel’s least attractive, but it was perfectly well appointed with a very comfortable bed, and we weren’t expecting anything more as it was the last available on a special deal. The staff were helpful, friendly and competent. There were a couple of longish delays between courses being served, but these were recognised and apologised for, and a price worth paying for freshly and well prepared food. There’s a pleasant garden and decking for sitting outside, and a cosy bar with a laptop available for the use of guests. If you want a hotel with a lot of public space and facilities this is not likely to be the choice for you, but for a comfortable, well positioned hotel that offers good value and the personal touch, and does all the basics very well indeed, we would strongly recommend it. If you want to stay there, from our experience book through the hotel’s website or by phoning to get the best deal.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luvly room with stunning sea view, staff fantastic and ever so helpful. Food great not only Breakfast but also the evening Bistro. also the prices were very reasonable. I can recomend the fish in the evening ( they have regular specials taken from day boats)
reviews.title: long weekend at The Clifton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel with a KGB deal but I had to change the dates and then had a problem with the voucher. No problem. Changing the dates was easy - bearing in mind I changed weeks in advance. As we finally arrived on a Sunday, the proprietor said that he could wait to receive the KGB voucher the next morning! The room was small but had plenty of drawer space and was very clean. Thanks to the KGB deal, my husband and I had a fee bottle of wine to use with our meal but we stayed for the food because the menu looked so good. We weren't disappointed. It was wonderful. Please see the photos taken below of the food from our first night. I didn't sleep particularly well but that's more because I don't tend to sleep well away from home than from anything about the hotel.
reviews.title: Looking forward to going back to a great hotel!

reviews.text: Have just spent 3 nights at The Clifton with our two boys, aged 11 and 9. It has a lovely atmosphere, with very friendly staff. Food was delicious, both at breakfast and for the evening meals - we ate in twice during our stay. We had a family room on the top floor - plenty of space with a double bed and bunk-beds for the children. Will definitely stay again when we next visit the Isle of Wight.
reviews.title: Very friendly small hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Clifton for 3 nights. My husband and I were treating my 70 year old dad for his birthday. Our rooms were very comfortable and dad was nearby in the room next door. We were treated very well - and one evening when dad wasn't feeling too well - the proprietors went out of their way to ensure he was comfortable. Breakfasts are brilliant too! Fresh fruit and a lovely cooked breakfast to set you up for the day. Thank you for helping to ensure we had a memorable visit to the Isle of Wight!
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last week-end. The room although a little small was very comfortable with a very good mattress. Food was excellent both at breakfast and dinner. There is an al a carte menu but also two set menus, one for 2 courses at £14.00 and the other 3 courses for £17.50. I agree with a previous review that the showers needed some cleaning due to staining around the bottom of the shower, however I am sure this can be sorted out as this is a problem in all showers. Location is good as it is just a short walk to the shops, also you can walk down to the beach or take the lift. Unfortunately weather was not kind to us last week-end so we will be returning to this hotel next year and hope we can next time get better weather. I would suggest it is worth paying a little extra and getting a sea view room, the proprietor has even put binoculars in these rooms so you can pick out the different ships around. Overall a very nice homely hotel with good staff service.
reviews.title: Good hotel and nice location

reviews.text: We stayed here in very mixed weather - at one stage the owners had to cope with guttering torn off in high winds and causing a flood! - but the warmth of their welcome and the standard of service never varied. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and comfortable, the communal areas really welcoming and the views and walks unbeatable. We'd never been to Shanklin before, but after such a great stay we're looking forward to our next visit and would definitely book at the Clifton again.
reviews.title: A lovely first visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We planed our Easter week end in Isle of Wight. we had choice between several brochures and websites. We finally turned to this Hotel due to the Sea view, price, and proximity to the old village. The booking was very friendly, and we managed to get the desired room for the week end. We enjoyed the warm and welcoming atmosphere.
reviews.title: Such a lovely place.

reviews.text: Good choice for the breakfast, beautiful view, cleaned and well-furnished rooms, relaxing garden, charming staff.
reviews.title: perfect seaside retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the previous guests reviews we just knew we had to stay at the Clifton. Easy to find and park, a friendly welcome. Perfect room excellent food and service. Beautiful views out to sea and round the coast. Excellent position for Shanklin Chine and the old village with so many 'chocolate box' buildings.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay, thank you!

reviews.text: We only stayed one night in a 'family room' our 6 year old nephew loved the bunk beds, our room was well equiped, plenty of fluffy towels, tea, coffee, hot choc and nice biscuits all on offer. Many toiletry items available at reception free of charge.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay with no complaints

description: The Clifton’s privileged location on the cliff top offers an amazing sea view and makes it an ideal retreat for those in search of tranquility. The Conservatory Bistro offers a stunning view of the bay which can also be enjoyed from the lovely garden offering the perfect visual tonic to relax and revitalise, perhaps with a good book and an English Cream Tea, or refreshments from the licensed bar. Local is Best……with prime farming land all around us and a host of specialist growers and producers making the most of it, we usually have access to plenty of fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables, as well as quality fish and meat. The garden opens out to Keats Green and the lovely walk between Shanklin and Sandown (part of the Isle of Wight Coastal Path) with fantastic views across Sandown Bay. This also leads to the famous Shanklin Chine with a pathway down to the sandy beaches. Within easy reach by foot are the picturesque Shanklin Old Village with its thatched roofs, and the beautiful Rylstone Gardens.
